abstract: The press conference for Toshiba, creator of the HD DVD format, felt more like a funeral following the news last week that gives the rival Blu-ray format momentum.
snippet: The press conference for Toshiba, creator of the HD DVD format, felt more like a funeral following the news last week that gives the rival Blu-ray format momentum.
lead_paragraph: It had all the feeling of a wake, not a celebration. Toshiba, the major proponent and manufacturer of the HD DVD format, tried to put on a good face at Sunday’s C.E.S. press conference, but there was no denying that the decision by Warner Brothers late last week to release future feature films exclusively on Blu-ray clearly took the company by surprise, and may have dealt a fatal blow to its HD DVD format.

headline.main: Toshiba Plays Clinton to Sony’s Obama

abstract: Vudu, the movie store in a set-top-box, is adding high definition titles to its nascent service.
snippet: Vudu, the movie store in a set-top-box, is adding high definition titles to its nascent service.
lead_paragraph: As the major studios continue to battle over Blu-ray and HD DVD, the competing standards for high-definition DVDs, it’s always worth considering whether both camps are ultimately doomed – leapfrogged by straight-to-the-home digital downloads of high definition movies.

headline.main: High-Definition Movies, Without the Format War
